//The Scholar (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): This is an unforgiving, high risk / high reward archetype: with all headshots, it gets the fastest scout rifle TTK but becomes the slowest if you're hitting shots to the body. Comes with low base Stability and Handling values (an inherent attribute for this archetype), and a recoil stat that pulls to the side. The recoil can be fixed with a Counterbalance mod or by putting on Arrowhead Brake in Slot 1 but the slow fire rate makes this a little less essential than on most other weapon types. Otherwise, pick the best combination of Stability + Handling increases you can find among your barrel and masterwork options. As mentioned, this archetype requires headshots to be competitive, so the main perk slots are all about consistency increasing picks.|tags:PvP

//The Scholar (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP): This is an unforgiving, high risk / high reward archetype: with all headshots, it gets the fastest scout rifle TTK but becomes the slowest if you're hitting shots to the body. Comes with low base Stability and Handling values (an inherent attribute for this archetype), and a recoil stat that pulls to the side. The recoil can be fixed with a Counterbalance mod or by putting on Arrowhead Brake in Slot 1 but the slow fire rate makes this a little less essential than on most other weapon types. Otherwise, pick the best combination of Stability + Handling increases you can find among your barrel and masterwork options. As mentioned, this archetype requires headshots to be competitive, so the main perk slots are all about consistency increasing picks.|tags:PvP

//The Summoner
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Rangefinder is a no-brainer in Slot 4: for one, ARs need range help in the current meta to keep up with the hand cannons and pulse rifles they're going up against, and on the other hand, the alternatives aren't particularly desirable. For most of the other slots, I recommend stacking stability and recoil bumps as much as you can. Further range increases are also useful if that's what your roll comes with but ultimately, your true effective range will be restricted by your ability to keep the weapon stable against a distant target.|tags:PvP

//The Summoner
//notes: adam (PvP): Rangefinder is a no-brainer in Slot 4: for one, ARs need range help in the current meta to keep up with the hand cannons and pulse rifles they're going up against, and on the other hand, the alternatives aren't particularly desirable. For most of the other slots, I recommend stacking stability and recoil bumps as much as you can. Further range increases are also useful if that's what your roll comes with but ultimately, your true effective range will be restricted by your ability to keep the weapon stable against a distant target.|tags:PvP

//The Summoner (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): No reload perks on this one but combine the generally fast reload speed of auto rifles with a couple of stat bumps, and it will feel okay. Stack stability and recoil boosts everywhere else, and you've got a great AR that feels very satisfying. In Slot 4, Dragonfly lets you use Wrath of Rasputin to make warmind cells, and Rampage is there as a no-fuss option.|tags:PvE

//The Summoner (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Rangefinder is a no-brainer in Slot 4: for one, ARs need range help in the current meta to keep up with the hand cannons and pulse rifles they're going up against, and on the other hand, the alternatives aren't particularly desirable. For most of the other slots, I recommend stacking stability and recoil bumps as much as you can. Further range increases are also useful if that's what your roll comes with but ultimately, your true effective range will be restricted by your ability to keep the weapon stable against a distant target.|tags:PvP

//The Summoner (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP): Rangefinder is a no-brainer in Slot 4: for one, ARs need range help in the current meta to keep up with the hand cannons and pulse rifles they're going up against, and on the other hand, the alternatives aren't particularly desirable. For most of the other slots, I recommend stacking stability and recoil bumps as much as you can. Further range increases are also useful if that's what your roll comes with but ultimately, your true effective range will be restricted by your ability to keep the weapon stable against a distant target.|tags:PvP

//Igneous Hammer
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): Due to their low fire rate, 120s occupy a rare spot among primaries: One For All is not automatically the best damage perk on them! It's still really good but I'd take Rampage over it for a pure add clear weapon. Either way, you will need a reload boost because these have the slowest base reload speeds in the game. Their base range is usually satisfactory so I'd focus Stability in Slot 1.|tags:PvE

//Igneous Hammer
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): For beefier, high-level enemies, we need perks that don't require kills, i.e. the classic Rapid Hit + One For All combo. Engagement distances are also longer (since you're trying to stay back for safety) so Range increases become more valuable—try to find your preferred Range/Stability split.|tags:PvE

//Igneous Hammer
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): If you have played any PvP recently, this weapon needs no introduction. To get the most out of it, I'd recommend finding the best combo that increases all of Stability, Range, and Handling. For the main perks in Slot 3 and 4, you can build either an incredibly dominant multi-kill weapon by combining Killing Wind + Rampage, or a consistent stat monster with Quickdraw or Rapid Hit in Slot 3 and Moving Target in Slot 4. Your Slot 3 perk will determine which of the aforementioned 3 stats you should deprioritize in the first two slots: Killing Wind gives you a Range increase, Rapid Hit takes care of Stability, and Quickdraw partially offsets Handling (if you end up with Quickdraw + Snapshot, you can basically ignore Handling in the other slots).|tags:PvP

//notes: adam (PvP): If you have played any PvP recently, this weapon needs no introduction. To get the most out of it, I'd recommend finding the best combo that increases all of Stability, Range, and Handling. For the main perks in Slot 3 and 4, you can build either an incredibly dominant multi-kill weapon by combining Killing Wind + Rampage, or a consistent stat monster with Quickdraw or Rapid Hit in Slot 3 and Moving Target in Slot 4. Your Slot 3 perk will determine which of the aforementioned 3 stats you should deprioritize in the first two slots: Killing Wind gives you a Range increase, Rapid Hit takes care of Stability, and Quickdraw partially offsets Handling (if you end up with Quickdraw + Snapshot, you can basically ignore Handling in the other slots).|tags:PvP

//Igneous Hammer (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): Due to their low fire rate, 120s occupy a rare spot among primaries: One For All is not automatically the best damage perk on them! It's still really good but I'd take Rampage over it for a pure add clear weapon. Either way, you will need a reload boost because these have the slowest base reload speeds in the game. Their base range is usually satisfactory so I'd focus Stability in Slot 1.|tags:PvE

//Igneous Hammer (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): For beefier, high-level enemies, we need perks that don't require kills, i.e. the classic Rapid Hit + One For All combo. Engagement distances are also longer (since you're trying to stay back for safety) so Range increases become more valuable—try to find your preferred Range/Stability split.|tags:PvE

//Igneous Hammer (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): If you have played any PvP recently, this weapon needs no introduction. To get the most out of it, I'd recommend finding the best combo that increases all of Stability, Range, and Handling. For the main perks in Slot 3 and 4, you can build either an incredibly dominant multi-kill weapon by combining Killing Wind + Rampage, or a consistent stat monster with Quickdraw or Rapid Hit in Slot 3 and Moving Target in Slot 4. Your Slot 3 perk will determine which of the aforementioned 3 stats you should deprioritize in the first two slots: Killing Wind gives you a Range increase, Rapid Hit takes care of Stability, and Quickdraw partially offsets Handling (if you end up with Quickdraw + Snapshot, you can basically ignore Handling in the other slots).|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=2527666306&perks=1482024992,1885400500,706527188,588594999
dimwishlist:item=2527666306&perks=1482024992,1885400500,706527188,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=2527666306&perks=1482024992,1885400500,247725512,588594999

//Igneous Hammer (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP): If you have played any PvP recently, this weapon needs no introduction. To get the most out of it, I'd recommend finding the best combo that increases all of Stability, Range, and Handling. For the main perks in Slot 3 and 4, you can build either an incredibly dominant multi-kill weapon by combining Killing Wind + Rampage, or a consistent stat monster with Quickdraw or Rapid Hit in Slot 3 and Moving Target in Slot 4. Your Slot 3 perk will determine which of the aforementioned 3 stats you should deprioritize in the first two slots: Killing Wind gives you a Range increase, Rapid Hit takes care of Stability, and Quickdraw partially offsets Handling (if you end up with Quickdraw + Snapshot, you can basically ignore Handling in the other slots).|tags:PvP

//Shayura's Wrath
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): This weapon doesn't have the most amazing PvE perks but it's worth keeping around for the simple reason that it is the only non-sunset Void SMG. On one hand, element coverage is always good to have. But even more importantly, Nezarec's Sin warlocks can turn this into a beast with Adrenaline Junkie (especially on Devour), with constant uptime on the damage bonus, allowing you to shred everything in your path.|tags:PvE

//Shayura's Wrath
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): If you want more consistency for the first kill, Dynamic Sway Reduction + Tap The Trigger is the way to go. I usually favor these rolls but this weapon feels good enough without that extra stability that the benefits are not as keenly felt as Kill Clip, which transforms it from a great weapon to an unstoppable one. Killing Wind and Tunnel Vision are the best companions, especially the former, as range extending perks can be real difference makers for an SMG. Similarly, I'd spend Slot 1, Slot 2, and the masterwork to boost Range first and foremost, and stacking Stability wherever it's possible to do so without trading in a lot of Range.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=3682803680&perks=1482024992,3142289711,2450788523,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=3682803680&perks=1482024992,3142289711,2946784966,1015611457

//Shayura's Wrath (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): If you want more consistency for the first kill, Dynamic Sway Reduction + Tap The Trigger is the way to go. I usually favor these rolls but this weapon feels good enough without that extra stability that the benefits are not as keenly felt as Kill Clip, which transforms it from a great weapon to an unstoppable one. Killing Wind and Tunnel Vision are the best companions, especially the former, as range extending perks can be real difference makers for an SMG. Similarly, I'd spend Slot 1, Slot 2, and the masterwork to boost Range first and foremost, and stacking Stability wherever it's possible to do so without trading in a lot of Range.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=4023807721&perks=1482024992,3142289711,2450788523,1015611457

//Astral Horizon
//notes: adam (PvP / including retired perks / optimal): After the Quickdraw removal and nerf, Threat Detector has emerged as the closest replacement: it provides similar effects as long as an enemy is within 15 meters of you, which is generally when you want to pull your shotgun out anyways. Your next best option is Surplus, but that does require you to manage ability cooldowns more thoughtfully. Opening Shot is a free aim assist boost, and the obvious pick in Slot 4. As for the barrels, Full Choke is the best option to increase consistency. If you can't get that to roll, pick whatever gives the highest handling increase to improve draw and ADS speed.|tags:PvP

//Astral Horizon (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvP / including retired perks): After the Quickdraw removal and nerf, Threat Detector has emerged as the closest replacement: it provides similar effects as long as an enemy is within 15 meters of you, which is generally when you want to pull your shotgun out anyways. Your next best option is Surplus, but that does require you to manage ability cooldowns more thoughtfully. Opening Shot is a free aim assist boost, and the obvious pick in Slot 4. As for the barrels, Full Choke is the best option to increase consistency. If you can't get that to roll, pick whatever gives the highest handling increase to improve draw and ADS speed.|tags:PvP

//Sola's Scar
//notes: adam (PvE / add clear / optimal): Chain Reaction is the must-have perk here: not only does it turn this sword into an AOE add clear weapon, it will also let you create warmind cells with the explosions if you have Wrath of Rasputin on. If you can get Tireless Blade to roll with it, you have hit the jackpot: the Chain Reaction kills count towards sword kills. Since Tireless Blade refunds ammo for every other kill, you can get virtually infinite ammo as long as you keep racking up those Chain Reaction explosion kills.|tags:PvE

//Friction Fire
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): A very solid kinetic SMG at the time of its release, this was immediately supplanted by Extraordinary Rendition in the next season when it comes to most PvE situations. The one thing the Rendition cannot roll is Wellspring, so I'd look for that unique roll here. This weapon doesn't have great damage perk options anyways, and SMG base damage is enough that you can get by without them in low level content. Stat wise, I'd prioritize Reload and Handling, two pain points when it comes to base stats. Reload boosts are plentiful in Slot 2 and 3, which leaves Slot 1 and the MW for Handling (or as a second option, Stability) bumps. |tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=1513993763&perks=1840239774,4134353779,4071163871,3592538738

//Friction Fire
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): A very solid kinetic SMG at the time of its release, this was immediately supplanted by Extraordinary Rendition in the next season when it comes to most PvE situations. The one thing the Rendition cannot roll is Wellspring, so I'd look for that unique roll here. This weapon doesn't have great damage perk options anyways. Stat wise, I'd prioritize Reload and Handling, two pain points when it comes to base stats. Reload boosts are plentiful in Slot 2 and 3, which leaves Slot 1 and the MW for Handling (or as a second option, Stability) bumps. |tags:PvE

//Friction Fire
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs): A very solid kinetic SMG at the time of its release, this was immediately supplanted by Extraordinary Rendition in the next season when it comes to most PvE situations. The one thing the Rendition cannot roll is Wellspring, so I'd look for that unique roll here. This weapon doesn't have great damage perk options anyways. Stat wise, I'd prioritize Reload and Handling, two pain points when it comes to base stats. Reload boosts are plentiful in Slot 2 and 3, which leaves Slot 1 and the MW for Handling (or as a second option, Stability) bumps. |tags:PvE

//Friction Fire
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): A very strong PvP SMG, with a lot of potential range thanks to Killing Wind. However, there are stronger alternatives in both slots, namely Multimach CCX and Shayura's Wrath. If you really want a kinetic 600rpm (multimach is a 900rpm) or if you're having trouble getting a good roll on those—this one is definitely much easier to grind for—keep one of these, otherwise those two are a better use of your vault space.|tags:PvP

//notes: adam (PvE), (PvP) Multiroll. See the original spreadsheets for individual notes: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UZLzMOq3pyQ670ozagR5TwXHUI7yA0nIxKeGOoY6vCo/edit?usp=sharing

//Royal Chase
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): Not sure what they were thinking with this one. It's the lowest-damage Scout Rifle archetype, and has no unique rolls compared to Vouchsafe, which is also void and can get the same rolls on top of its higher base damage. Keep it until you get a good Vouchsafe, or until they rebalance the archetypes. Your best roll on it is Multikill Clip (to get that damage output in a good place) with reload buffs to allow easier uptime on your damage perk.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=2776503072&perks=839105230,3177308360,2869569095,2458213969

//Deafening Whisper
//notes: adam (PvE), (PvP / optimal) Multiroll. See the original spreadsheets for individual notes: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UZLzMOq3pyQ670ozagR5TwXHUI7yA0nIxKeGOoY6vCo/edit?usp=sharing

dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=2010801679,4071163871

//Deafening Whisper
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): The only Season of the Hunt weapon worth actively grinding for: this is the only wave-frame GL in the game at the moment, which makes it the best add-clear special GL available. The perk options are solid, though not perfect. Ambitious Assassin is the best option in Slot 3 (mostly due to the lack of any great alternatives), allowing you to have 2 shots after almost every reload. Since this can clear groups with ease, Wellspring will provide a lot of utility and is my preferred pick in Slot 4, but Threat Detector could also be a good option as a reload perk. The only potential hiccup is that you might annihilate everything in Threat Detector range before the reload. Blast Radius is a wasted stat on this one, partly because it doesn't affect the wave size and damage (only the explosion around the initial projectile impact), and because there is a hard cap of 55 on these, which this already hits by default. Danger Zone appears to be the only perk option that can push past that, and it's not available here.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=3525010810,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=3798852852,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=2822142346,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=981718087&perks=2010801679,3592538738

//Deafening Whisper
//notes: adam (PvE): The only Season of the Hunt weapon worth actively grinding for: this is the only wave-frame GL in the game at the moment, which makes it the best add-clear special GL available. The perk options are solid, though not perfect. Ambitious Assassin is the best option in Slot 3 (mostly due to the lack of any great alternatives), allowing you to have 2 shots after almost every reload. Since this can clear groups with ease, Wellspring will provide a lot of utility and is my preferred pick in Slot 4, but Threat Detector could also be a good option as a reload perk. The only potential hiccup is that you might annihilate everything in Threat Detector range before the reload. Blast Radius is a wasted stat on this one, partly because it doesn't affect the wave size and damage (only the explosion around the initial projectile impact), and because there is a hard cap of 55 on these, which this already hits by default. Danger Zone appears to be the only perk option that can push past that, and it's not available here.|tags:PvE

//Death Adder
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): I personally find this one a little hard to control but if you can tame it, there is a solid add clear SMG in here. With no traditional damage perks, Dragonfly is the obvious choice in Slot 4, especially with the solar element allowing you to proc Wrath of Rasputin with the explosions. 900 rpms run out of ammo real quick, so Feeding Frenzy is very good to have, with everything else spent on increasing Stability to get its kick under control.|tags:PvE

//Death Adder

//Widow's Bite
//notes: adam (PvP): Mostly an instant shard weapon but if you're really into rapid fire frames, you can stack a bunch of accuracy + aim assist increases on it, and give it a shot. For PvE, Ikelos sniper is a solar rapid fire with much better rolls and warmind cells.|tags:PvP

//IKELOS_SG_v1.0.2
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): The Rapid-fire archetype's fast RPM should let you get a nice chunk of burst damage out with Trench Barrel (which no other rapid-fire can roll), but the need to refresh the buff after every 3 shots makes it an overall lower DPS option than Vorpal, which provides a smaller damage increase but does so passively. Pellet shotguns aren't really part of the current DPS meta but this is a strong option to keep in your vault in case they ever get a blanket buff, and its warmind cell generating capabilities already give it enough utility to make it a viable option if you ever feel like switching things up. As a rapid fire frame, it eats through ammo real quick so try to get some reload boosts, with the rest of the stat boosts spent on handling where possible.|tags:PvE
